description.narrative: The Project “Support to Country Coordinating Mechanism (CCM) for 2020-2022” is aimed to assist to the CCM to conduct its business by providing the necessary administrative, secretarial, communications, and logistical support.

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

activity-description.narrative: Conduct of CCM meetings in Nur-Sultan

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Indicator 2.1 Number of CSOs that have the capacity to engage in critical development and crisis-related issues, disaggregated by women’s, youth, persons with disabilities, other excluded groups. Output indicators: 1.1 Number of newly selected CCM members being trained and able to take part in the decision making process 2.1 Percentage of fully implemented CCM Oversight activities (CCM oversight visits, LFA briefings, Oversight Committee meetings)

comment.narrative: Country Coordinating Mechanism need for capacity building for the enhancement of the international cooperation

CCM Secretariat provided administrative, logistical and communication support to the CCM, ensured equal participation of all constituencies including civil society organizations, representatives of the key populations (people living with HIV (PLHIB), people who inject drugs (PWID), sex workers (SW), men who have sex with men (MSM), women living with HIV), ex-TB patients, academic and private sector representatives in the CCM activities. CCM Oversight function is fully implemented. KAP participation in national decision making bodies formalized through a KAP Platform School of Parliamentarians and Key Populations is established, focused on strengthening the role of KP and Parliamentarians to eliminate direct and circumstantial barriers and improve access to ARV treatment, diagnostics and reaching second 90%; Module for teachers and students were developed and integrated into schedule of National Commission.

CCM Secretariat provided administrative, logistical and communication support to the 17 CCM members - representatives of NGOs, key populations (MSM, transgender women, IDUs, PLHIV, ex-prisoners and SWs) and international organizations to ensure equal participation of all constituencies in the CCM activities.
CCM Oversight function is fully implemented. Oversight visits were held to Atyrau, Pavlodar and Turkestan regions to monitor the national AIDS and Tb Responses, identify grant risks and potential mitigation measures. Based on the results of the analysis, the oversight committee made recommendations to the PR and to the CCM to address identified issues and bottlenecks. Results of the CCM Oversight functions for 2021 has been presented at the CCM partners meeting. 6 consultation meetings facilitated by UNDP CCM Secretariat and Oversight Committee with euro Bureau WHO, MoH, Country team of the Global Fund, PRs and international partners were resulted on the obtaining the import licenses on procurement of methadone.
KAP participation in national decision-making bodies formalized through a KAP Platform. Analytical report on mapping of the consultative healthcare platforms has been developed and agreed at the consultation meeting with participation of Deputy of Senat of RK and task force members. The Platform facilitates communication and collaboration between KPs, Parliamentarians and NGOs. 12 representatives of the CSOs, including KP and PLHIV were included in the working groups of the Parliament to participate in the legislative process and to contribute to changes in national legislation to eliminate stigma and discrimination, as well as improve the sustainability and quality of HIV and TB services. 20 representatives of the CCM from CSOs trained on preparation, planning, organizing, and monitoring CCM representatives’ elections by the CS, KP and PLWD constituencies.
The supplementary proposal for US $3 mln. developed and endorsed to mitigate the implications of COVID - 19 for Tb programmes. The application includes activities in response to the needs and requirements of the KP and strengthening the capacity of the health system.
CCM Secretariat supported the establishment of a School of Parliamentarians and Key Populations with its sustainability ensured through integration into the State Social Order Programme of the Ministry of Information and Public development in Nur-Sultan.
The final draft of Tb proposal for 8 mln dollars has been presented and validated during the Country Dialogue meeting
The CCM web - site updated on regular basis and fully functional.

CCM Secretariat provided administrative, logistical and communication support to the CCM, ensured equal participation of all constituencies including civil society organizations, representatives of the key populations (people living with HIV (PLHIB), people who inject drugs (PWID), sex workers (SW), men who have sex with men (MSM), women living with HIV), ex-TB patients, academic and private sector representatives in the CCM activities. CCM Oversight Committee is established and CCM Oversight function is fully implemented The Country Dialogue on development of a new HIV funding request for 2021-2023 is conducted.

The CCM Secretariat has been fully staffed and proceeded its operations. The CCM web - site updated on regular basis and fully functional. Resolution of Prime-Minister of Kazakhstan on endorsement of the new CCM composition adopted on May 05, 2020. Ensured equal participation of the representatives of the key populations (PLHIV, MSM, ex-TB patients, religious and academic sector representatives) in the 5 meetings that were resulted in the following: New Proposal for US $899,457 to mitigate the COVID19 impact for key populations has been developed and integrated into ongoing TB grant. New CCM Funding Request on HIV component was developed and approved; As a result, a new Grant agreement between CCM, MoH and Global Fund on Tb component for US $7,197,500 has been signed. Principal Recipients for GFATM HIV and COVID19 grants were appointed. Two international consultants were involved by CDC and UNAIDS to support the CCM on development of proposal and virtual evaluation of Lab equipment’s of the regional AIDS centers. 65 MSM and transgender community enhanced leadership skills and improved knowledge to build a dialogue with decision makers at the one training and Platform meetings. 20 NGO representatives and CCM members improved knowledge and skills at the joint UNDP/CCM and UNAIDS training on development of proposals, formulation of the estimated quantitative and qualitative outcome and impact indicators. 30 participants (CCM members and partners) enhanced their knowledge and skills through CCM training on CCM roles, functions and gender sensitive communication to participate in decision making on HIV and TB and eliminate programme barriers; Training conducted with technical assistance of experts from UNAIDS and UNDP CO. 26 CCM members and 2 CCM Secretariat staff were trained on the Global Fund requirements and rules and able to use the CCM Ethics Code. Capacities of 133 tuberculosis and HIV specialists and NGO staff have been enhanced by participation in oversight meetings which resulted in ability to provide both medical and social services considering the sustainability of services. CCM ensured increased awareness of at least 30 decision makers of the OST and MSM program assessment results and their focus on increasing state funding for HIV/AIDS prevention programs. 5 national and international experts with diseases, procurement, management skills and representative of key affected population were selected to CCM Oversight Committee. The CCM Oversight Committee meets GFATM requirements and fully functional. 23 organizations: 11 state healthcare facilities and 12 local civil society organizations were attended by Oversight committee during the visits to 3 regions (Karagandy, Mangystau, Nur-Sultan) to identify gaps and progress in implementation of national HIV and Tb programme (on sustainability of GF earlier funded programmes) and ongoing Global fund projects in 10 regions of Kazakhstan. 5 verification meetings were held with participation of Programme and Financial specialists of Price Water House Cooper, Local fund agents to discuss the results of LFA review and manage gaps.

CCM Secretariat provided administrative, logistical and communication support to the CCM, Ensured equal participation of all constituencies including civil society organizations, representatives of the key populations (people living with HIV (PLHIB), people who inject drugs (PWID), sex workers (SW), men who have sex with men (MSM), women living with HIV), ex-TB patients, academic and private sector representatives in the CCM activities. CCM Oversight function is fully implemented. KAP participation in national decision-making bodies formalized through a KAP Platform School of Parliamentarians and Key Populations is functioning with focus on strengthening the role of KP and Parliamentarians to eliminate direct and circumstantial barriers; Interaction with regional Health Departments and Maslikhats has been improved
